extensionDescription.message: Saves and restores complete windows in bookmarks.

restoreHereButtonTitle.message: Close active and open saved window

welcomeMessage.message:
Welcome to Window Saver!
 Hit the save button to get started.

renameButtonTitle.message: Keep the current Folder, but change it's name

showPlaceholder.message: Show placeholer when restoring restricted pages (instead of ignoring them)

deleteAfter.message: Always delete bookmarks after restoring windows

dublicateError.message:
Switching folders was aborted.
More than one folder with the chosen name is available.

placeholderFor.message: This is a placeholer for the page

placeholderExplanation1.message: Window Saver restored a window containing a "restricted" tab. Firefox has a security feature to stop just that, as extension interacting with "restricted" websites (e.g. the extention website or the browser settings page) could mess it up.

placeholderExplanation2.message: That's why Window Saver cannot reopen tabs of restricted websites. This placeholder is the best it can do. Access the saved tab by copy and pasting the URL above into the address bar.

placeholderTip.message: You can use Firefox's inbuilt bookmark menus to restore saved windows as well. Doing so requires a few more steps. It might be a preferable option for windows containing several restricted tabs. The quickest way to do so is the following:

placeholderTip3.message: Expand the Master Folder (default: 'Window Saver' in 'Other Bookmarks') with a left-click

placeholderTip4.message: Right-click on the saved window and choose 'Open All in Tabs' to restore it
